bookinfo.title:
Eclipse Rich Client Platform The complete guide to Eclipse application development
Lars Vogel
2007 2008 2009 2010 2011 2012 2013 2014 2015 2016 Lars Vogel
10.03.2016
Third edition
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../001_Books_Shared/legalnotice.adoc[]

book.part:
=== The concepts behind Eclipse and Eclipse based applications
=== Introduction to the Eclipse project <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipsePlatformDevelopment/011_foundation.adoc[] <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../Eclipse/010_overview.adoc[]
=== Eclipse plug-ins and applications <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/010_overview.adoc[]
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipsePlugIn/010_overview.adoc[]
=== Architecture of Eclipse
The following chapter gives an overview of the Eclipse architecture, explains the term _plug-ins_ and what extensions and extension points are.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/020_architecture.adoc[]
=== Using a target platform for development <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseTargetPlatform/010_overview.adoc[] <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseTargetPlatform/012_definition.adoc[]

=== Setting up an Eclipse RCP development environment
=== Install Java for Eclipse RCP development <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../Eclipse/016_installationrequirements.adoc[] <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../JavaIntroduction/012_installation.adoc[]
=== Install Eclipse IDE for RCP development
Installation
The following description explains how to install the Eclipse IDE and the required tools to develop Eclipse RCP applications.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/040_download_eclipsesdk.adoc[] <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../Eclipse/020_installation.adoc[] <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../Eclipse/022_gettingstarted.adoc[]
=== Install the e4 tools
=== Requirements
To install the tools required for Eclipse RCP development you need to know how to use the Eclipse update manager. Open menu: Help Install new software...
for this.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/042_tutorial_installation_e4tools.adoc[]
=== Exercise: Enable Java access to all plug-ins <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseCodeAccess/032_addtosearch.adoc[]
=== Exercise: Defining a target platform <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseTargetPlatform/020_tutorial_setup.adoc[]

=== Creating and exporting Eclipse applications
=== Product configuration file <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseProductDeployment/010_product.adoc[]
=== The usage of run configurations
This chapter describes the usage of the _run configuration_ and highlights typical problems with them.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/090_runconfiguration.adoc[] <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/091_runconfiguration_product.adoc[]
=== Common launch problems
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/092_runconfiguration_problems.adoc[]

=== Deployment of your RCP application <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseProductDeployment/020_deployment.adoc[]
=== More about the target platform
See
for more information about the target platform configuration.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseProductDeployment/022_deployment.adoc[]
=== Common product export problems <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseProductDeployment/080_problems_export.adoc[]

=== Application model
=== Eclipse application model <xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../EclipseRCP/120_applicationmodel.adoc[]

<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../Eclipse4LiveModelEditor/010_overview.adoc[]
=== Installation requirements
The usage of the model spy requires the installation of the Eclipse 4 - Core Tools as described in
.
<xi:include xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="../Eclipse4LiveModelEditor/012_ide.adoc[]

The exact details of applying this modular approach is covered in
.

. The dedicated section

=== Extend the Eclipse application model
It is also possible to extend the application model. This requires knowledge about the Eclipse EMF framework. Describing EMF is currently out of scope for this book. See http://www.vogella.com/tutorials/Eclipse4ExtendModel/article.html">Extending the Eclipse 4 application model for an introduction into the concepts.
